A graduate of [[Worcester Academy]] and the [[University of Colorado at Boulder|University of Colorado]], Toomey was named [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s ''[[Wide World of Sports (U.S. TV series)|Wide World of Sports]]'' Athlete of the Year in 1968. He received the [[James E. Sullivan Award]] as the top amateur athlete in the United States in 1969. Toomey married Olympic gold-medal winning British athlete [[Mary Rand]] in 1969 and they had two daughters, Samantha and Sarah. They divorced after 22 years of marriage. Toomey was head coach in track and field at the [[University of California at Irvine]] in the early 1970s.{{Citation needed|date=September 2010}} ==External links== *http://vm.mtsac.edu/relays/HallFame/Toomey.html *http://www.bill-toomey.com/ ==References== *[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/to/bill-toomey-1.html sports-reference] {{S-start}} {{S-ach|rec}} {{Succession box|before={{Flag icon|FRG}} [[Kurt Bendlin]]|title=[[Decathlon#World records|Men's decathlon world record holder]]|years=December 11, 1969 â€“ September 8, 1972|after={{Flag icon|URS}} [[Mykola Avilov]]}} {{S-ach}} {{Succession box|title=[[Track & Field Athlete of the Year]]|before={{Flag icon|USA}} [[Bob Beamon]]|after={{Flag icon|USA}} [[Randy Matson]]|years=[[1969 in athletics (track and field)|1969]]}} {{S-end}} {{Footer Olympic Champions Decathlon}} {{Footer Pan American Champions Decathlon Men}} {{Footer Universiade Champions Decathlon Men}} {{Sullivan Award winners}} {{Footer USA Track & Field 1968 Summer Olympics}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Toomey, Bill | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Toomey, William Anthony | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American decathlete | DATE OF BIRTH = January 10, 1939 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Toomey, Bill}} [[Category:University of Colorado at Boulder alumni]] [[Category:Worcester Academy alumni]] [[Category:1939 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American decathletes]] [[Category:James E.
